response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Maximum Product of Three\", \"description\": \"#### Problem Statement\\nGiven an array of integers, find the maximum product of three elements. The product may be obtained by multiplying any three numbers from the array.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef max_product(arr: list[int)) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `arr` (list[int]): A list of integers.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the maximum product of three elements in the input array.\\n\", \"code\": \"def max_product(arr: list[int)) -> int:\\n    # Sort the array in descending order\\n    arr.sort(reverse=True)\\n    # Calculate the maximum product of three numbers from the array\\n    return max(arr[0] * arr[1] * arr[2], arr[-1] * arr[-2] * arr[-3])\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert max_product([-10, -20, 0, 40]) == 120\", \"assert max_product([1, 2, 3, 4, 5]) == 60\", \"assert max_product([-1, 0, 1]) == 0\"] }"
